titleInfo.title: HACKNEY v. SHANNON et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MAGISTRATE JUDGE PETER B. SCUDERI'S REPORT AND RECOMMENDATIONS THAT THE PETITION FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS BE DISMISSED. THERE HAS BEEN NO SUBSTANTIAL SHOWING OF THE DENIAL OF A CONSSTITUTIONAL RIGHT REQUIRING THE ISSUANCE OF A CERTIFICATE OF APPEALABILITY. OBJECTIONS TO R&R DUE BY 1/26/2007. SIGNED BY JUDGE PETER B. SCUDERI ON 1/4/07. (Attachments: # (1) Proposed Order) 1/5/07 ENTERED AND COPIES MAILED, E-MAILED.(pr, )

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:06-cv-03490; HACKNEY v. SHANNON et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of Pennsylvania
extension.docketText: MAGISTRATE JUDGE PETER B. SCUDERI'S REPORT AND RECOMMENDATIONS THAT THE PETITION FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS BE DISMISSED. THERE HAS BEEN NO SUBSTANTIAL SHOWING OF THE DENIAL OF A CONSSTITUTIONAL RIGHT REQUIRING THE ISSUANCE OF A CERTIFICATE OF APPEALABILITY. OBJECTIONS TO R&R DUE BY 1/26/2007. SIGNED BY JUDGE PETER B. SCUDERI ON 1/4/07. (Attachments: # (1) Proposed Order) 1/5/07 ENTERED AND COPIES MAILED, E-MAILED.(pr, )

titleInfo.title: HACKNEY v. SHANNON et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER THAT UPON CAREFUL AND INDEPENDENT CONSIDERATION OF THE PLEADINGS AND THE RECORD HEREIN, AND AFTER REVIEW OF THE REPORT AND RECOMMENDATION OF U.S. MAGISTRATE JUDGE PETER B. SCUDERI, AND HAVING RECEIVED NO OBJECTIONS THERETO, IT IS ORDERED THAT THE REPORT AND RECOMMENDATION IS APPROVED AND ADOPTED. THE PETITION FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS PURSUANT TO 28 USC, SECTION 2254, IS DISMISSED. THERE IS NO PROBABLE CAUSE TO ISSUE A CERTIFICATE OF APPEALABILITY. . SIGNED BY JUDGE BRUCE W. KAUFFMAN ON 1/29/07. 1/30/07 ENTERED AND COPIES MAILED, E-MAILED.(pr, )
